2021-11-13.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-13.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-13.name: Winter Art Fair Off the Square
Art on the Prairie
2021-11-13.summary: This free festival northwest of Des Moines showcases more than 100 Iowa artists, poets and musicians in seven venues, including the Hotel Pattee, in the downtown historic and cultural district. There will also be children's activities.

2021-11-13.name: Pangea
2021-11-13.summary: Celebrate global cultures at the Hjemkomst Center, with folk dancing, storytelling, music and foods from seven countries. Children can pick up a passport to get stamped at booths.

2021-11-14.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-14.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-14.name: Winter Art Fair Off the Square
Art on the Prairie
2021-11-14.summary: This free festival northwest of Des Moines showcases more than 100 Iowa artists, poets and musicians in seven venues, including the Hotel Pattee, in the downtown historic and cultural district. There will also be children's activities.

2021-11-15.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-15.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-16.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-16.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-17.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-17.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-18.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-18.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-18.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2021-11-18.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2021-11-18.name: Winterer's Gathering
2021-11-18.summary: There's a tent encampment, winter skills seminars, Arctic film festival and chili feed at the North House Folk School.

2021-11-19.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-19.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-19.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2021-11-19.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2021-11-19.name: Christkindlmarket
2021-11-19.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2021-11-19.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2021-11-19.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2021-11-19.name: ZooLights
2021-11-19.summary: The annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is operating at limited capacity again this year and charging $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays and Tuesdays. Reserve in advance.

2021-11-19.name: Festive Friday Eves
2021-11-19.summary: Five Christmas celebrations, each with a different theme, at Cedar Creek Settlement,  a restored 1864 woolen mill in this historic village just north of Milwaukee. Each features live holiday music, crafts, luminaries, wine-tasting and cookies and cider.

2021-11-19.name: Winterer's Gathering
2021-11-19.summary: There's a tent encampment, winter skills seminars, Arctic film festival and chili feed at the North House Folk School.

2021-11-19.name: Virtual Holiday Folk Fair International
2021-11-19.summary: More than 50 ethnic groups present music, dance, food and crafts from around the world. At the Wisconsin State Fair Exposition Center.

2021-11-19.name: Outdoor Adventure Expo
2021-11-19.summary: The expo at the Midwest Mountaineering store on the West Bank includes dozens of speakers and seminars about skiing, sled-dog racing and ice-climbing as well as camping, backpacking and other year-round adventures.

2021-11-19.name: Christkindlmarkt
2021-11-19.summary: This Lake Michigan town holds its Old World Christmas market in Lakehaven Hall, with a craft market, music and German food. On Friday, there's a holiday lights parade at 6:30 p.m.

2021-11-20.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-20.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-20.name: Holiday Lights Festival

2021-11-20.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2021-11-20.summary: Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.

2021-11-20.name: ZooLights
2021-11-20.summary: The annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is operating at limited capacity again this year and charging $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays and Tuesdays. Reserve in advance.

2021-11-20.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2021-11-20.name: Magnificent Mile Lights Festival & Parade
2021-11-20.summary: There will be music and family activities on Michigan Avenue, with a  lighted parade from Oak Street to Wacker Drive, followed by fireworks over the Chicago River.

2021-11-20.name: Christmas Light Parade
2021-11-20.summary: The 6 p.m. parade includes live reindeer, horses, marching bands and floats. See Santa at the Al Ringling Theatre afterward for photos and treats.

2021-11-20.name: Holiday Parade
2021-11-20.summary: The parade starts at 10 a.m. downtown, at Jefferson and Stuart streets.

2021-11-23.name: Downtown Appleton Christmas Parade
2021-11-23.summary: Wisconsin's largest night-time Christmas parade starts at 7 p.m. at the corner of State Street and College Avenue.

2021-11-25.name: Lakeside Park Holiday Lights
2021-11-25.summary: This free light show on Lake Winnebago includes animated scenes and trees that dance to 20 minutes of music played on 87.9 FM (you can listen on your car radio).

2021-11-25.name: Thanksgiving Parade
2021-11-25.summary: It's the 86th anniversary of the parade down State Street in the Loop. It starts at 8 a.m. at State Street and Ida B. Wells Drive and moves northward toward Randolph.

2021-11-26.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2021-11-26.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2021-11-26.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2021-11-26.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2021-11-26.name: Christkindlmarket
2021-11-26.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2021-11-26.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2021-11-26.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2021-11-26.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2021-11-26.summary: Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.

2021-11-26.name: Lakeside Park Holiday Lights
2021-11-26.summary: This free light show on Lake Winnebago includes animated scenes and trees that dance to 20 minutes of music played on 87.9 FM (you can listen on your car radio).

2021-11-26.name: Rotary Lights
2021-11-26.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There's also an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2021-11-26.name: ZooLights
2021-11-26.summary: The annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is operating at limited capacity again this year and charging $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays and Tuesdays. Reserve in advance.

2021-11-26.name: Christkindlsmarkt
2021-11-26.summary: The open-air market in this Minneapolis suburb on Lake Minnetonka also includes concerts, balloon art, storytelling, reindeer, visits with the Christkind, mugs of warm Glühwein and children's lantern parades at 5 p.m. both Saturdays.

2021-11-26.name: Holly Days
2021-11-26.summary: This Door County village offers horse-drawn wagon rides, a children's elf hunt and mistle dough contest and caroling.

2021-11-26.name: European Christmas Market
2021-11-26.summary: This Christkindlmarkt in Union Depot features choirs, dancers, hot mulled wine, holiday beers,  European-inspired food and artisan goods.

2021-11-26.name: German Christmas Market
2021-11-26.summary: This downtown market features vendors in outdoor huts as well as heated tents  for music, German food, gingerbread-decorating and a beer garden.

2021-11-26.name: Holiday Kerstmarkt
2021-11-26.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2021-11-26.name: Chris Kringle Market
2021-11-26.summary: This town on the Illinois River kicks off its downtown festival with a parade at 6 p.m. Nov. 26, followed by fireworks.

2021-11-26.name: Door County Christkindlmarkt
2021-11-26.summary: This market on the grounds of the Corner of the Past Museum, a recreated pioneer homestead south of town, features local vendors and artisans, live music, and German dishes served inside a large barn.

2021-11-26.name: World-Famous Fish House Parade
2021-11-26.summary: The goofier the float, the better in this north-woods town, 12 miles from the north shore of Mille Lacs. There's music, food and a craft sale before and after the 1 p.m. parade.

2021-11-26.name: Holiday Stroll
2021-11-26.summary: This Mississippi River town offers a window-display scavenger hunt, parade, wagon rides and Santa.

2021-11-26.name: Festive Friday Eves
2021-11-26.summary: Five Christmas celebrations, each with a different theme, at Cedar Creek Settlement,  a restored 1864 woolen mill in this historic village just north of Milwaukee. Each features live holiday music, crafts, luminaries, wine-tasting and cookies and cider.

2021-11-26.name: Festival of Lights Parade
2021-11-26.summary: In this northwest suburb of Chicago, the holiday parade starts at 7 p.m.

2021-11-26.name: Parade of Lights
2021-11-26.summary: The holiday parade downtown will be from 6 to 7 p.m.

2021-11-30.summary: This free light show on Lake Winnebago includes animated scenes and trees that dance to 20 minutes of music played on 87.9 FM (you can listen on your car radio).

2021-11-30.name: Rotary Lights
2021-11-30.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There's also an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2021-11-30.name: ZooLights
2021-11-30.summary: The annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is operating at limited capacity again this year and charging $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays and Tuesdays. Reserve in advance.

2021-11-30.name: Holiday Kerstmarkt
2021-11-30.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2021-11-04.name: Driftless Film Festival
2021-11-04.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2021-11-05.name: Driftless Film Festival
2021-11-05.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2021-11-05.name: Witching Hour Festival
2021-11-05.summary: This festival focuses on the creative processes of musicians, artists, comedians, writers, thinkers, scientists and magicians, a "jungle gym for your mind and soul."

2021-11-06.name: Driftless Film Festival
2021-11-06.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.

2021-11-06.name: Witching Hour Festival
2021-11-06.summary: This festival focuses on the creative processes of musicians, artists, comedians, writers, thinkers, scientists and magicians, a "jungle gym for your mind and soul."

2021-11-06.name: Veterans Day Parade
2021-11-06.summary: It's at 11 a.m., starting on Wisconsin Avenue, crossing the river and heading north on Water Street. After the parade, there's a festival at the Marcus Center, with music, entertainment and a veteran-owned market.

2021-11-07.name: Driftless Film Festival
2021-11-07.summary: See independent films and meet filmmakers in the 1916 opera house of this artistic town west of Madison.
